text: bump
Are you using Firefox? There were a lot of issues with it and the Design Manager as the new beta is getting rolled out. I stay in Chrome for now.
HubSpot blog comments feature has a captcha which appears to be using outdated script <https://spin.d.pr/QJjAPj+>
Do you have a link to the blog post that was on?
<http://laackemfg-4038812.hs-sites.com/blog/sample-post>
Hm. cc: <@U24DCSJBE>, <@U87NGNETZ>
I've had issues with this as well. You can enable captcha on the form itself which uses the newer one, but then you get both the new and the old one...
I think you are only supposed to get the new one, but Shay (tagged above) likely has more specifics and can comment here.

I've got a fun new situation...

working on a page and all of a sudden it's stopped loading.

The preview continues to load no problem: <http://www.seventhheaven.ca/dbvenues?hs_preview=WvPMMYiP-5550283049>

The actual published page does nothing: <http://www.seventhheaven.ca/dbvenues>
fortunately in my case - I don’t even think the client will want comments enabled, but figured you guys would want to address that - probably not the only one getting that.
Anyone else encountered anything like this before?
Both load for me
I second what Matt said
That's good to hear.  Not working for anyone in my office
Could be an internal DNS issue
What is returned on `nslookup`?
`nslookup <http://www.seventhheaven.ca|www.seventhheaven.ca>`
Also what happens when you put a random query string in the url?
This is an issue with the comment form itself, the Blog team are aware of it, and working on a solution. cc <@U3VN3LMME>
with a random query string, it loads no problem
when I add ?hsDebug=true doesn't load

```Server:		192.168.1.1
Address:	192.168.1.1#53

<http://493596g46.secure022.HubSpot.net|493596g46.secure022.HubSpot.net>	canonical name = <http://493596.group46.sites.HubSpot.net|493596.group46.sites.HubSpot.net>.
<http://493596.group46.sites.HubSpot.net|493596.group46.sites.HubSpot.net>	canonical name = <http://group46.sites.hscoscdn40.net|group46.sites.hscoscdn40.net>.
```

This looks like a CDN edge issue
Where are you located/
Toronto, Ontario, Canada
What does the JS console display?
Also are you getting an error or does it just spin?
No errors.  Just `initializing content script message listener`
<@U54TVT3C1> Have you tried on your cellphone network? We have this issue from time to time with our office firewall.
What happens on `104.17.114.180`?
same issue persists on my cell network
error 1003
Yeah, actually it's not loading for me either... in the DC area if that helps
The <http://www.seventhheaven.ca/dbvenues> doesn't load for me
sorry... this stuff is a little over my head.  Just a lowly front end dev here.
Do you get an error page back?
Might've found something; this works: <https://www.seventhheaven.ca/dbvenues>
Possible SSL issue?
hmmmmmmm... that works for me too
I wonder if someone else set up SSL provisioning without me knowing.
Might be as easy as checking "force SSL" in the domain manager
I don't. Seems that it may be an SSL issue.  page is loading fine on https
Can you take a screenshot of the page that isn't loading with the console up?
pming you.  can't add an img to a thread
Thanks for your help folks
<@U6AEA3EV6>
I always use Chrome. :disappointed:
Hi guys! I have a question please. Is it possible to insert a HubSpot CTA inside an Advanced Menu?

I haven’t ever tried, but I’m pretty certain the answer is no. If you wanna try though you’d need to use the hubl code for a CTA.

Otherwise a developer can just position the cta to look like it’s in the nav

Yeah, I'm leaning with Jon here. I've gone for that design before, but we didn't need the CTA tracking in this instance, so I just created a different style for the :last-child item to make it look and act like a button
That's what the client has
but they want full CTA to track the clicks
Thanks for helping
this is what I do often times. That or place a CTA next to the menu
you can create a trackable link and use that
Agreed with <@U7V9DQ31P> you can also use the link that is given in the CTA as a link also. i've done this with CTA's for email where i have used <https://buttons.cm/> and then the CTA link
essentially just grab the href from the a tag in the embed code.
<@U22PU4G4A> who should I ask on this? thanks!

Anyone else unable to load default content in classic custom modules anymore? I keep adding a default placeholder for a text field over and over and it will never show on Template preview. It was working in page editor sometimes, but now that doesn’t even work. So, so weird.
Hey <@U2SJA29B4>. It's not in beta yet, but I'll pass your message along to the team working on it. I'm not sure on the exact timeline for beta, but I can ask.
okay, i’ll tell client to be patient. thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
